content: When the MyObject.class file is found, the JVM's class loader loads the class in memory, and creates a java.lang.Class object. The JVM stores the code in memory, allocates memory for the static variables, and executes any static initialize block.  Memory is not allocated for the object member variables at this point, memory will be allocated for them when an instance of the class, an object, is created.
